Staff are working diligently to digest the requirements and create draft plans for our safe return to school in the fall. Your input is important to our planning. You can find the link to the survey by clicking below.

It is clear that this fall we will all be operating in an unfamiliar environment that will require us to be flexible. But despite that, I am confident that our staff will rise to the occasion and continue to serve our students well in these new conditions.

ATTENTION YCIS:

At approximately 9:00 today, we received communication from YCSD administration that we were having an emergency situation that required our students to be contained in their classrooms. Our building (YCIS) was immediately put into Lock Down mode where all students remained contained in their classrooms. While this status is generally used when there is an imminent threat or danger, this was not the case. One of our students was having a medical emergency that required paramedics and emergency responders, this event took place as we were about to transition between classes and we wanted to give this student and the EMS workers as much privacy as possible. We want to be clear that at no time was our building under any type of threat or danger. We are very proud of the response by our students, staff and first responders. The entire Lock down event lasted less than five minutes.

Thank you.
Yamhill Carlton School District

Heather Roberts YC Bbx is with Bobbi Mickey-Richmond and 7 others.
March 1 at 12:01 PM ¬∑

So the YC boys basketball season has come to a close with a hard fought loss to defending two time state champs - DelaSalle. What has been a big win is the season. What a great ride. The boys went from a 4 win season last year to 16 wins this year and making state playoffs. They worked super hard, bought in to the program and came together as a team. We were also led by our outstanding senior - Gavin Tuning. What a leader and he will be missed.

Last night (besides the score) was the best. We played at the Salvation Army because DelaSalle doesn't have a gym. There is one set of bleachers - the crowd started filing in at 5. We had a great YC contingency there all sporting the orange and black. Crowd cheered and were a great support, we even did a YC chant at the end. The atmosphere was so fun and a lifetime memory. This is a great experience for the boys and hopefully next year we can make it to the tourney. Thank you so much for everyone who came and supported the team this year. It means a lot. #stayuponthatrise #hardworkpaysoff #funjourney #yctigers

UPDATE 2-10 @ 3pm - The broilers are back up and working properly. Heat has been restored to both campuses. School is not cancelled.

Original message:

Dear YC Intermediate and High School Parents,

Unfortunately we had major problems with the boiler systems at both the Intermediate and High Schools today. The Intermediate School electronic controls systems are going through a retrofit and for some reason the new system quit working and heat was not directed to the classrooms. In an unfortunate coincidence, the boiler at the high school quit working as well. We have repair teams called out to get both systems back online.

The result of these issues is that the classrooms were chilly today. I apologize for this state of affairs, if we had realized that the heating systems were not going to be repaired by mid-morning, I would have canceled classes for the day. If the systems are not working tomorrow, school will be cancelled. A call will go out in the morning if that is the case.

Again, I apologize for the chilly learning environment today.

Charan Cline
YCSD Superintedent

Yamhill-Carlton Wrestling Program
January 19 at 11:40 AM ¬∑

YC went 5-1 in duals at the Oregon dual state classic. This was good for fourth place overall.

On day 1 the 'gers went 3-0 besting ranked pleasant Hill, Santiam Christian and edging out second ranked Dayton. The pirates ended up placing second in the entire tournament.

On day 2 the tigers lost a back and fourth dual with Willamina. This dropped YC to the backside where they would win out and claim fourth.

Side Note:
YC, Dayton and Willimina are all in the same wrestling district - all of whom placed 4th, 2nd and 3rd; respectively. I personally think this shows how tough are league and kids are.

Side Note #2: Multiple refferess and other tournament officials complemented us on our sportsmanship and gentlemen-like behavior. Some things about our sport are bigger than actual wrestling. This to me was more rewarding than placing.

Special thanks to the parents who made this happen when the travel plans went awry.

#YCAchieves #WeareYC
